description.value: Greeting card for the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah. Features a white menorah with nine candles and a six-pointed Star of David cut out of the center. Below, on the triangular-shaped base, a larger, blue and white Star of David appears in the center.

provenance: Ted Naos, Baltimore, MD; 1998: acquired by Museum

summary.title: Season's Greetings (Greeting card)
ephemera
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department

description.value: Greeting card illustrated with a city street during a snowstorm in winter. Groups of male figures in black hats and uniforms in the street shoveling snow into trailers pulled by horses and automobiles. On sidewalks, rows of pedestrians, many with umbrellas. Two streetlights and perspective view of buildings in foreground, view of abstracted shop fronts and buildings at left. Blue vertical border at left edge with a column of white snowflakes. Printed text interior.

provenance: Marilyn Friedman, New York, NY; 2016 acquired by Museum

summary.title: snowflakes
streetlights
holiday card

title.value: Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year 1962, Herbert and Joella Bayer

summary.title: Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year 1962, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
graphic design
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department

description.value: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring a reproduction of Bayer's painting, "Linear Structure with Orange Field" (1959), an abstract composition with black, blue, orange, and white rectangular shapes and lines. Verso: Printed in orange, across lower portion: merry christmas and a happy new year  1962 herbert and joella bayer.

medium.value: Offset lithograph on glossy white paper

provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

summary.title: WCAU-TV Philadelphia (Greeting card)
graphic design
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department

description.value: Square greeting card featuring Herbert Bayer's painting "The Yellow Center." Printed text, interior: SEASON'S GREETINGS FROM THE STAFF OF WCAU-TV. Verso: Small black and white photoreproduction of printed recto image with credit to Herbert Bayer. Printed text below: Screen print 1970, 31" x 31" / Herbert Bayer, Austrial designer 1900- / Reproduced in cooperation with the Philadelphia Museum of Art / and with permission from Marlborough Graphics Inc; same design as 7102.845.2016, 7102.847.2016.

title.value: Greetings from Aspen's Touring Country, Merry Christmas and Happy Near Year from Herbert and Joella Bayer

summary.title: Greetings from Aspen's Touring Country, Merry Christmas and Happy Near Year from Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
graphic design
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department

description.value: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring black and white photographic reproduction of ski slopes in Aspen, Colorado with superimposed Aspen logo (green aspen tree leaf with white snowflake) at lower left and center right. Printed in green cursive script, lower right: Greetings from Aspen's Touring Country. Verso: Aspen logo in green at top, green ruled borders. Printed in red, left: merry christmas / and / happy new year / from / herbert and joella / bayer.

provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

summary.title: What Reason So To Knock (greeting card)
graphic design
American
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department

description.value:
Poster/ greeting card printed in black ink.  Text in calligraohic style throughout.
Recto: Across center, text giving holiday greeting; along edges, abstract flourishes and good luck symbols such as horseshoe, four leaf clover.  Lower right quadrant, affixed small round sticker with green tree on white with red edge. 
Verso: Across sheet, map overlaid by grid; at center of each square, small circle with heavenly body such as star, planet, comet inside.
